p: The permeation of lamotrigine from matrix patch using various permeation enhancers was studied and specified in Fig. 3. Formulation A3 containing oleic acid showed maximum permeation at hour 12 with the highest flux of 0.916 mg/cm 2h, enhancement ratio of 3.55, the regression coefficient of 0.9958 and best-fit equation Q t = 0.916t–0.044. In a similar study, where Eudragit RS 100 and 10% oleic acid were used the highest permeation of drug salbutamol sulfate was observed (Misra 2014). Formulation A2 comprising of lemon oil as a penetration enhancer showed its maximum burst at 15 min that might be because some essential oils are compatible with the buffer medium that means they would not take longer to solubilize inside a solvent thus letting drug to be exposed to the medium. However, the polymer, Eudragit ® RS resisted the buffer exposure and controlled the release by 77% at the hour 12. Similar studies were conducted by Jiang et al., where different permeation enhancers were used and concluded that essential oils are safe, non-toxic and an effective way of delivering many drugs across skin by causing a reversible change in the stratum corneum. (Jiang et al. 2017).
